headlines.description: Tom Brady threw four touchdowns to his tight ends, with three going to his favorite target, Rob Gronkowski, as the Super Bowl champion New England Patriots beat Pittsburgh 28-21.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brady throws 4 TDs, 3 to Gronk, in Patriots' win

video.headline: Skip and Stephen A.'s differing views on Pats' win

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (First Take on Pats' win) 2015/09/11 EFT

video.headline: Will headset issues mar Patriots' win?

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysisi (Do headset issues mar Patriots' win?) 2015/09/11 SC

headlines.description: Aaron Rodgers threw for three touchdowns, two to James Jones, and the Green Bay Packers beat Chicago 31-23 to spoil John Fox's debut as Bears coach Sunday afternoon.
headlines.shortLinkText: Rodgers, James Jones lead Packers over Bears 31-23

headlines.description: Alex Smith threw for 243 yards and three touchdowns in the first half as the Kansas City Chiefs built a big lead and held on for a 27-20 victory over the mistake-prone Houston Texans on Sunday.

video.headline: Chiefs QB Alex Smith, Texans DE J.J. Watt earn game balls

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (Texas-Chiefs Game Balls) 2015/9/13 NFL Nation TV

headlines.shortLinkText: Smith's 3 touchdown passes lead Chiefs over Texans, 27-20

headlines.description: Ryan Fitzpatrick threw two touchdown passes and Chris Ivory ran for two scores, giving the New York Jets a 31-10 victory Sunday over the Cleveland Browns in coach Todd Bowles' debut.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (Jets/Browns Game Balls) 2015/9/13 NFL Nation TV

headlines.shortLinkText: Fitzpatrick, Ivory lead Jets to 31-10 win over Browns

headlines.description: Tyrod Taylor engineered three touchdown drives and Rex Ryan's attacking Buffalo defense put the clamps on Andrew Luck and the Indianapolis Colts in a 27-14 season-opening victory on Sunday.

video.headline: Taylor's mistake-free debut earns Bills' game ball

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (Colts/Bills Game Ball) 2015/09/13 NFL NATION TV

headlines.shortLinkText: Bills bully Colts to win 27-14 in Rex Ryan's Buffalo debut

headlines.description: Jarvis Landry returned a punt 69 yards for a touchdown with 10:22 left to give Miami its first lead, and the Dolphins held on to beat the Washington Redskins 17-10 Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Landry's punt return carries Dolphins over Redskins 17-10

headlines.description: Josh Norman returned an interception for a touchdown, and the Carolina Panthers did just enough offensively to beat the Jacksonville Jaguars 20-9 in the teams' season opener Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Panthers get defensive score, beat Jaguars 20-9 in opener

headlines.description: Greg Zuerlein kicked a 37-yard field goal in overtime and the Rams survived an 18-point fourth quarter rally by the Seattle Seahawks, beating the two-time defending NFC champions 34-31.

video.headline: Rams QB Nick Foles earns game ball for gutsy performance

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (Seahawks/Rams Game Ball) 2015/09/13 NFL NATION TV

headlines.shortLinkText: Rams finish OT upset after big Seahawks rally

headlines.description: Carson Palmer threw three touchdown passes in his first game back from a torn ACL and the Arizona Cardinals opened their season with a 31-19 victory over the New Orleans Saints on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Palmer throws for 3 TDs, Cardinals beat Saints 31-19

headlines.description: Philip Rivers rallied San Diego to 30 straight points, including throwing a go-ahead, 13-yard touchdown pass to tight end Ladarius Green early in the fourth quarter, and the Chargers stunned the
headlines.shortLinkText: Rivers rallies Chargers to victory over Lions

headlines.description: Marcus Mariota made it look easy, throwing four touchdown passes and outplaying No. 1 overall draft pick Jameis Winston to lead the Tennessee Titans to a 42-14 season-opening victory over the Tam
headlines.shortLinkText: Mariota throws 4 TDs, outplays Winston, Titans rout Bucs

headlines.description: Andy Dalton threw for 269 yards and two touchdowns and Jeremy Hill ran for two scores to help the Cincinnati Bengals spoil coach Jack Del Rio's debut in Oakland with a 33-13 victory over the Raid
headlines.shortLinkText: Bengals spoil Del Rio's debut with 33-13 win over Raiders

venue.fullName: Sports Authority Field at Mile High

headlines.description: Former Ravens safety Darian Stewart, who followed Gary Kubiak from Baltimore to Denver over the winter, snatched the ball from tight end Crockett Gillmore in the end zone with 28 seconds left to

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL News (Terrell Suggs Out For Season) 2015/9/13 SportsCenter

headlines.shortLinkText: Broncos beat Ravens 19-13 as defense comes up big

headlines.description: Down 10 points in the fourth quarter, Tony Romo threw a pair of TDs to Jason Witten -- the game winner with 7 seconds to play -- as Dallas overcame multiple mistakes to win its opener Sunday.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (Herm On Dez Bryant Injury) 2015/9/13 SportsCenter DAL

headlines.shortLinkText: Romo-to-Witten TDs lift Dallas to dramatic win

headlines.description: Julio Jones had 141 yards receiving and two touchdowns, Matt Ryan shook off a pair of interceptions, and the Atlanta Falcons came back to beat the Philadelphia Eagles 26-24 on Monday night.

video.headline: Falcons show a lot of enthusiasm and energy in victory

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (Falcons show a lot of enthusiasm and energy in victory) 2015/09/14 CC

headlines.shortLinkText: Falcons stave off Eagles' second-half comeback

headlines.description: Carlos Hyde outplayed Adrian Peterson, rushing for 168 yards and two touchdowns, and Jim Tomsula's San Francisco 49ers defeated Minnesota in his debut as head coach minus the interim status.

video.headline: Carlos Hyde, Anthony Barr awarded with game balls for their efforts

tracking.trackingName: COM_NFL Analysis (49ers/Vikings Game Balls) 2015/9/14 NFL Nation TV

headlines.shortLinkText: Hyde rumbles for 168 yards, 2 TDs as 49ers roll
